trans-unit.source: Windows Universal Apps Reach SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal Apps Reach SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate Azure Mobile Engagement Reach with Windows Universal Apps
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate Azure Mobile Engagement Reach with Windows Universal Apps

trans-unit.source: You must follow the integration procedure described in the <linkText>Windows Universal Engagement SDK Integration</linkText><title></title> before following this guide.
trans-unit.target: You must follow the integration procedure described in the <linkText>Windows Universal Engagement SDK Integration</linkText><title></title> before following this guide.

trans-unit.source: You do not have anything to add.
trans-unit.target: You do not have anything to add.

trans-unit.source: EngagementReach references and resources are already in your project.
trans-unit.target: EngagementReach references and resources are already in your project.

trans-unit.source: You can customize images located in the Resources folder of your project, especially the brand icon (that default to the Engagement icon).
trans-unit.target: You can customize images located in the Resources folder of your project, especially the brand icon (that default to the Engagement icon).

trans-unit.source: On Universal Apps you can also move the Resources folder on your shared project to share its content between apps, but you will have to keep the Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml file on its default location as it is platform dependent.
trans-unit.target: On Universal Apps you can also move the Resources folder on your shared project to share its content between apps, but you will have to keep the Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml file on its default location as it is platform dependent.

trans-unit.source: In order to use the Windows Notification Service (referred as WNS) in your Package.appxmanifest file on Application UI click on All Image Assets in the left bot box.
trans-unit.target: In order to use the Windows Notification Service (referred as WNS) in your Package.appxmanifest file on Application UI click on All Image Assets in the left bot box.

trans-unit.source: At the right of the box in Notifications, change toast capable from (not set) to (Yes).
trans-unit.target: At the right of the box in Notifications, change toast capable from (not set) to (Yes).

trans-unit.source: Moreover, you need to synchronize your app to your Microsoft account and to the engagement platform.
trans-unit.target: Moreover, you need to synchronize your app to your Microsoft account and to the engagement platform.

trans-unit.source: For this you need to create an account or log on <linkText>windows dev center</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For this you need to create an account or log on <linkText>windows dev center</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After that create a new application and find the SID and secret key.
trans-unit.target: After that create a new application and find the SID and secret key.

trans-unit.source: On the engagement frontend, go on your app setting in native push and paste your credentials.
trans-unit.target: On the engagement frontend, go on your app setting in native push and paste your credentials.

trans-unit.source: After that, right click on your project, select store and Associate App with the Store....
trans-unit.target: After that, right click on your project, select store and Associate App with the Store....

trans-unit.source: You just need to select the application you have create before to synchronize it.
trans-unit.target: You just need to select the application you have create before to synchronize it.

trans-unit.source: Modify the App.xaml.cs:
trans-unit.target: Modify the App.xaml.cs:

trans-unit.source: Add to your using statements :
trans-unit.target: Add to your using statements :

trans-unit.source: Insert EngagementReach.Instance.Init just after EngagementAgent.Instance.Init in OnLaunched :
trans-unit.target: Insert EngagementReach.Instance.Init just after EngagementAgent.Instance.Init in OnLaunched :

trans-unit.source: If you want to enable engagement reach when your app is activated by a command, another application or a custom scheme, override OnActivated method:
trans-unit.target: If you want to enable engagement reach when your app is activated by a command, another application or a custom scheme, override OnActivated method:

trans-unit.source: The EngagementReach.Instance.Init runs in a dedicated thread.
trans-unit.target: The EngagementReach.Instance.Init runs in a dedicated thread.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to do it yourself.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to do it yourself.

trans-unit.source: You can specify the name of the WNS push channel of your application in the Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml file of your project on .
trans-unit.target: You can specify the name of the WNS push channel of your application in the Resources\EngagementConfiguration.xml file of your project on .

trans-unit.source: By default, Engagement creates a name based on the appId.
trans-unit.target: By default, Engagement creates a name based on the appId.

trans-unit.source: You have no need to specify the name yourself, except if you plan to use the push channel outside of Engagement.
trans-unit.target: You have no need to specify the name yourself, except if you plan to use the push channel outside of Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Engagement provides two ways to implement Reach notification and announcement: the Overlay integration and the Web View integration.
trans-unit.target: Engagement provides two ways to implement Reach notification and announcement: the Overlay integration and the Web View integration.

trans-unit.source: Overlay integration doesn't require a lot of code to write into your application.
trans-unit.target: Overlay integration doesn't require a lot of code to write into your application.

trans-unit.source: You just need to tag your pages, xaml and cs files, with EngagementPageOverlay.
trans-unit.target: You just need to tag your pages, xaml and cs files, with EngagementPageOverlay.

trans-unit.source: Moreover, if you customize the Engagement default view, your customization will be shared with all tagged pages and just defined once.
trans-unit.target: Moreover, if you customize the Engagement default view, your customization will be shared with all tagged pages and just defined once.

trans-unit.source: But if your pages need to inherit from an object other than EngagementPageOverlay, you are stuck and forced to use Web View integration.
trans-unit.target: But if your pages need to inherit from an object other than EngagementPageOverlay, you are stuck and forced to use Web View integration.

trans-unit.source: Webview integration is more complicated to be implemented.
trans-unit.target: Webview integration is more complicated to be implemented.

trans-unit.source: But if your App pages need to inherit from an object other than "Page", then you have to integrate the Web View and its behavior.
trans-unit.target: But if your App pages need to inherit from an object other than "Page", then you have to integrate the Web View and its behavior.

trans-unit.source: You should consider adding a root level element to surround all page content.
trans-unit.target: You should consider adding a root level element to surround all page content.

trans-unit.source: For Webview integration, just add Webview as child of this grid.
trans-unit.target: For Webview integration, just add Webview as child of this grid.

trans-unit.source: If you need to set Engagement component elsewhere, remember that you have to manage the display size yourself.
trans-unit.target: If you need to set Engagement component elsewhere, remember that you have to manage the display size yourself.

trans-unit.source: Engagement provides an overlay for notification and announcement display.
trans-unit.target: Engagement provides an overlay for notification and announcement display.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use it, do not use webview integration.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use it, do not use webview integration.

trans-unit.source: In your .xaml file change EngagementPage reference to EngagementPageOverlay
trans-unit.target: In your .xaml file change EngagementPage reference to EngagementPageOverlay

trans-unit.source: Add to your namespaces declarations:
trans-unit.target: Add to your namespaces declarations:

trans-unit.target: Replace engagement:EngagementPage with engagement:EngagementPageOverlay:

trans-unit.target: With EngagementPage:

trans-unit.target: With EngagementPageOverlay:

trans-unit.target: With EngagementPageOverlay for 8.1:

trans-unit.source: Then in your .cs file tag your page in "EngagementPageOverlay" instead of "EngagementPage" and import "Microsoft.Azure.Engagement.Overlay".
trans-unit.target: Then in your .cs file tag your page in "EngagementPageOverlay" instead of "EngagementPage" and import "Microsoft.Azure.Engagement.Overlay".

trans-unit.source: Replace EngagementPage with EngagementPageOverlay:
trans-unit.target: Replace EngagementPage with EngagementPageOverlay:

trans-unit.target: With EngagementPage:

trans-unit.target: With EngagementPageOverlay:

trans-unit.source: Now this page uses the engagement overlay mechanism, you don't have to insert a web view.
trans-unit.target: Now this page uses the engagement overlay mechanism, you don't have to insert a web view.

trans-unit.source: The Engagement overlay uses the first “Grid” element it finds in your xaml file to add two web views on your page.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement overlay uses the first “Grid” element it finds in your xaml file to add two web views on your page.

trans-unit.source: If you want to locate where web views will be set, you can define a grid named “EngagementGrid” like this:
trans-unit.target: If you want to locate where web views will be set, you can define a grid named “EngagementGrid” like this:

trans-unit.source: You can customize the overlay notification and announcement directly on their xaml and cs files:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the overlay notification and announcement directly on their xaml and cs files:

trans-unit.source: EngagementAnnouncement.html : The Announcement web view html design.
trans-unit.target: EngagementAnnouncement.html : The Announcement web view html design.

trans-unit.source: EngagementOverlayAnnouncement.xaml : The Announcement xaml design.
trans-unit.target: EngagementOverlayAnnouncement.xaml : The Announcement xaml design.

trans-unit.source: EngagementOverlayAnnouncement.xaml.cs : The EngagementOverlayAnnouncement.xaml linked code.
trans-unit.target: EngagementOverlayAnnouncement.xaml.cs : The EngagementOverlayAnnouncement.xaml linked code.

trans-unit.source: EngagementNotification.html : The Notification web view html design.
trans-unit.target: EngagementNotification.html : The Notification web view html design.

trans-unit.source: EngagementOverlayNotification.xaml : The Notification xaml design.
trans-unit.target: EngagementOverlayNotification.xaml : The Notification xaml design.

trans-unit.source: EngagementOverlayNotification.xaml.cs : The EngagementOverlayNotification.xaml linked code.
trans-unit.target: EngagementOverlayNotification.xaml.cs : The EngagementOverlayNotification.xaml linked code.

trans-unit.source: EngagementPageOverlay.cs : The Overlay announcement and notification display code.
trans-unit.target: EngagementPageOverlay.cs : The Overlay announcement and notification display code.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use it, do not use Overlay integration.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use it, do not use Overlay integration.

trans-unit.source: To display engagement content, you need to integrate the two xaml WebView in each page and you need to display notification and announcement.
trans-unit.target: To display engagement content, you need to integrate the two xaml WebView in each page and you need to display notification and announcement.

trans-unit.source: So add this code in your xaml file:
trans-unit.target: So add this code in your xaml file:

trans-unit.target: For 8.1 integration:

trans-unit.target: And your associate .cs file have to look like:

trans-unit.source: This implementation embedded WebView resizing when the device screen is turned.
trans-unit.target: This implementation embedded WebView resizing when the device screen is turned.

trans-unit.source: If you want your application to be able to receive Reach data pushes, you have to implement two events of the EngagementReach class:
trans-unit.target: If you want your application to be able to receive Reach data pushes, you have to implement two events of the EngagementReach class:

trans-unit.source: In App.xaml.cs in "Public App(){}" add:
trans-unit.target: In App.xaml.cs in "Public App(){}" add:

trans-unit.source: You can see that the callback of each method returns a boolean.
trans-unit.target: You can see that the callback of each method returns a boolean.

trans-unit.source: Engagement sends a feedback to its back-end after dispatching the data push.
trans-unit.target: Engagement sends a feedback to its back-end after dispatching the data push.

trans-unit.source: If the callback returns false, the exit feedback will be send.
trans-unit.target: If the callback returns false, the exit feedback will be send.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, it will be action.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, it will be action.

trans-unit.source: If no callback is set for the events, the drop feedback will be returned to Engagement.
trans-unit.target: If no callback is set for the events, the drop feedback will be returned to Engagement.

trans-unit.source: Engagement is not able to receive multiples feedbacks for a data push.
trans-unit.target: Engagement is not able to receive multiples feedbacks for a data push.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to set several handlers on an event, be aware that the feedback will correspond to the last one sent.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to set several handlers on an event, be aware that the feedback will correspond to the last one sent.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we recommend to always returns the same value to avoid having confusing feedback on the front-end.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we recommend to always returns the same value to avoid having confusing feedback on the front-end.

trans-unit.source: We allow you to customize the reach UI.
trans-unit.target: We allow you to customize the reach UI.

trans-unit.source: To do so, you have to create a subclass of the EngagementReachHandler class.
trans-unit.target: To do so, you have to create a subclass of the EngagementReachHandler class.

trans-unit.source: Sample Code :
trans-unit.target: Sample Code :

trans-unit.source: Then, set the content of the EngagementReach.Instance.Handler field with your custom object in your App.xaml.cs class within the App() method.
trans-unit.target: Then, set the content of the EngagementReach.Instance.Handler field with your custom object in your App.xaml.cs class within the App() method.

trans-unit.source: Sample Code :
trans-unit.target: Sample Code :

trans-unit.source: By default, Engagement uses its own implementation of EngagementReachHandler.
trans-unit.target: By default, Engagement uses its own implementation of EngagementReachHandler.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to create your own, and if you do so, you don't have to override every method.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to create your own, and if you do so, you don't have to override every method.

trans-unit.source: The default behavior is to select the Engagement base object.
trans-unit.target: The default behavior is to select the Engagement base object.

trans-unit.source: By default, Reach will use the embedded resources of the DLL to display the notifications and pages.
trans-unit.target: By default, Reach will use the embedded resources of the DLL to display the notifications and pages.

trans-unit.source: To provide a full customization possibilities we only use web view.
trans-unit.target: To provide a full customization possibilities we only use web view.

trans-unit.source: If you want to customize layouts, override directly the resources files EngagementAnnouncement.html and EngagementNotification.html.
trans-unit.target: If you want to customize layouts, override directly the resources files EngagementAnnouncement.html and EngagementNotification.html.

trans-unit.source: Engagement needs all code in to run correctly.
trans-unit.target: Engagement needs all code in to run correctly.

trans-unit.source: But you can add tag outer engagement_webview_area.
trans-unit.target: But you can add tag outer engagement_webview_area.

trans-unit.source: However, you can decide to use your own resources.
trans-unit.target: However, you can decide to use your own resources.

trans-unit.source: You can override EngagementReachHandler methods in your subclass to tell Engagement to use your layouts, but take care to embedded the engagement mechanism:
trans-unit.target: You can override EngagementReachHandler methods in your subclass to tell Engagement to use your layouts, but take care to embedded the engagement mechanism:

trans-unit.source: Sample Code :
trans-unit.target: Sample Code :

trans-unit.source: By default, AnnouncementHTML is ms-appx-web:///Resources/EngagementAnnouncement.html.
trans-unit.target: By default, AnnouncementHTML is ms-appx-web:///Resources/EngagementAnnouncement.html.

trans-unit.source: It represents the html file that design the content of a push message (Text announcement, Web anoucement and Poll announcement).
trans-unit.target: It represents the html file that design the content of a push message (Text announcement, Web anoucement and Poll announcement).

trans-unit.source: AnnouncementName is engagement_announcement_content.
trans-unit.target: AnnouncementName is engagement_announcement_content.

trans-unit.source: It is the name of the webview design in your xaml page.
trans-unit.target: It is the name of the webview design in your xaml page.

trans-unit.source: NotfificationHTML is ms-appx-web:///Resources/EngagementNotification.html.
trans-unit.target: NotfificationHTML is ms-appx-web:///Resources/EngagementNotification.html.

trans-unit.source: It represents the html file that design the notification of a push message.
trans-unit.target: It represents the html file that design the notification of a push message.

trans-unit.source: NotfificationName is engagement_notification_content.
trans-unit.target: NotfificationName is engagement_notification_content.

trans-unit.source: It is the name of the webview design in your xaml page.
trans-unit.target: It is the name of the webview design in your xaml page.

trans-unit.source: You can customize notification and announcement web view has you want if you preserve Engagement object.
trans-unit.target: You can customize notification and announcement web view has you want if you preserve Engagement object.

trans-unit.source: Take care that webview object is described three times - the first time in your xaml, second time in your .cs file in the "setwebview()" method, and third time in the html file.
trans-unit.target: Take care that webview object is described three times - the first time in your xaml, second time in your .cs file in the "setwebview()" method, and third time in the html file.

trans-unit.source: In your xaml you describe the current graphical layout webview component.
trans-unit.target: In your xaml you describe the current graphical layout webview component.

trans-unit.source: In your .cs file you can define "setwebview()" in which you set the dimension of the two webview (notification, announcement).
trans-unit.target: In your .cs file you can define "setwebview()" in which you set the dimension of the two webview (notification, announcement).

trans-unit.source: It is very effective when the application is resizing.
trans-unit.target: It is very effective when the application is resizing.

trans-unit.source: In the Engagement html file we describe the webview content, design and the elements positions between each other.
trans-unit.target: In the Engagement html file we describe the webview content, design and the elements positions between each other.

trans-unit.source: When a user clicks on a system notification (a toast), Engagement launches the application, load the content of the push messages, and display the page for the corresponding campaign.
trans-unit.target: When a user clicks on a system notification (a toast), Engagement launches the application, load the content of the push messages, and display the page for the corresponding campaign.

trans-unit.source: There is a delay between the launch of the application and the display of the page (depending on the speed of your network).
trans-unit.target: There is a delay between the launch of the application and the display of the page (depending on the speed of your network).

trans-unit.source: To indicate to the user that something is loading, you should provide a visual information, like a progress bar or a progress indicator.
trans-unit.target: To indicate to the user that something is loading, you should provide a visual information, like a progress bar or a progress indicator.

trans-unit.source: Engagement cannot handle that itself, but provides a few handlers for you.
trans-unit.target: Engagement cannot handle that itself, but provides a few handlers for you.

trans-unit.source: To implement the callback, in App.xaml.cs in "Public App(){}" add:
trans-unit.target: To implement the callback, in App.xaml.cs in "Public App(){}" add:

trans-unit.source: You can set the callback in your "Public App(){}" method of your App.xaml.cs file, preferably before the EngagementReach.Instance.Init() call.
trans-unit.target: You can set the callback in your "Public App(){}" method of your App.xaml.cs file, preferably before the EngagementReach.Instance.Init() call.

trans-unit.source: Each handler is called by the UI Thread.
trans-unit.target: Each handler is called by the UI Thread.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to worry when using a MessageBox or something UI-related.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to worry when using a MessageBox or something UI-related.

trans-unit.source: We provide custom scheme use.
trans-unit.target: We provide custom scheme use.

trans-unit.source: You can send different type of URI from engagement frontend to be used in your engagement application.
trans-unit.target: You can send different type of URI from engagement frontend to be used in your engagement application.

trans-unit.source: Default scheme like http, ftp, ... are manage by Windows, a window will prompt if they are no default application installed on device.
trans-unit.target: Default scheme like http, ftp, ... are manage by Windows, a window will prompt if they are no default application installed on device.

trans-unit.source: Other scheme like application scheme can be used.
trans-unit.target: Other scheme like application scheme can be used.

trans-unit.source: Moreover, you can use a custom scheme for your application.
trans-unit.target: Moreover, you can use a custom scheme for your application.

trans-unit.source: The simple way to set a custom scheme in your application is to open your Package.appxmanifest go in Declarations panel.
trans-unit.target: The simple way to set a custom scheme in your application is to open your Package.appxmanifest go in Declarations panel.

trans-unit.source: Select Protocol in the Available Declarations scroll box and add it.
trans-unit.target: Select Protocol in the Available Declarations scroll box and add it.

trans-unit.source: Edit the Name field with your new protocol desired name.
trans-unit.target: Edit the Name field with your new protocol desired name.

trans-unit.source: Now to use this protocol, edit your App.xaml.cs with the OnActivated method, and don't forget to initialize engagement here also:
trans-unit.target: Now to use this protocol, edit your App.xaml.cs with the OnActivated method, and don't forget to initialize engagement here also:
